clinical_study.brief_title: The Match Study in ESRD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Measurements of AV Access Blood Flow With the Alio Medical Remote Monitoring System to Determine Maturation Status and Patency in ESRD Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single arm, observational study designed;' / Up to 100 participants with chronic kidney disease (CKD) stage IV or V (End Stage Renal Disease, ESRD) who have either a newly created or functioning AV access will be enrolled at up to five (5) clinical sites. Participants in both groups will continuously wear the SmartPatch for up to eight (8) weeks and undergo standard-of-care surveillance and treatment to assess their AV maturation and/or patency.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, single arm, observational study designed to assess arteriovenous (AV) access maturation and patency as determined by auscultation and AV access blood flow using the Alio Medical Remote Monitoring System (RMS) as compared to standard techniques.
Up to 100 participants with chronic kidney disease (CKD) stage IV or V (End Stage Renal Disease, ESRD) who have either a newly created or functioning AV access will be enrolled at up to five (5) clinical sites. Participants in both groups will continuously wear the SmartPatch for up to eight (8) weeks and undergo standard-of-care surveillance and treatment to assess their AV maturation and/or patency. During this time, clinical data will be collected from the SmartPatch and compared to standard of care auscultation and imaging (duplex ultrasound) assessments.

primary_outcome.description: Demonstrate the ability of the Alio Medical RMS to detect real-time maturation in a newly created AV fistula or graft in an ESRD patient.

secondary_outcome.description: Compare AV access blood flow measurements from the Alio Medical RMS to those obtained during standard of care Duplex ultrasound imaging

arm_group.description: ESRD patients will wear the Alio SmartPatch on top of their newly created vascular access

intervention.description: The Alio Medical RMS utilizes a wearable, non-invasive patch (SmartPatch) placed on the AV access of enrolled participants. The SmartPatch gathers physiologic data using optical, mechanical, electrical, acoustic and thermal sensors to collect physiologic data from the participant's vessel related to vascular access health (e.g. volumetric flow and stenosis) and hemodynamic parameters (e.g. Hb/Hct, K+) and transmits it to a bedside hub located in the clinic or participant's home. The Bedside Hub then relays this raw data to the Alio Medical Cloud where it is processed and analyzed utilizing Alio's proprietary algorithms. Data is then accessible to the clinical site and Alio Medical via a web-based portal.

study_pop.textblock: Up to 100 participants with chronic kidney disease (CKD) stage IV or V (End Stage Renal Disease, ESRD) who have either a newly created or functioning AV access will be invited to participate in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
At least 18 years of age
• Individual who has either: oAnewlycreatedAVfistulaorgraft(surgicalorendovascular)andiscurrentlywaitingforitto mature, or oAfunctioningAVfistulaorgraftandatelevatedriskforastenoticevent,asdeterminedbyeither clinical judgement or diagnostic testing
- Competent and willing to provide written informed consent to participate in the study
- Agrees to perform the protocol-mandated testing procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- • Pseudoaneurysm on the measured AV access
- Transposed AV fistula
- Skin near the proximity of the AV access that is swollen, infected and/or inflamed, or has skin eruptions, open wounds, or lesions
- Major cardiovascular surgery (not related to the vascular access), hospitalization, or systemic infection within the last 2 weeks
- Participants with novel indications for their arteriovenous fistula (AVF) or arteriovenous graft (AVG), such as HeRO grafts.
- AVF/AVG in a non-arm location (e.g. leg, abdomen or chest-wall)
- Pregnancy (if female and sexually active, participant must be using a reliable form of birth control, be willing to sign a waiver, be surgically sterile or be at least 2 years post-menopausal)
- Serious medical condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, may adversely affect the safety of the participant or the device being evaluated
